Top-3 Scripts:
su_1378797: find . -name "*.tar.gz" -execdir tar --one-top-level -xvzf {} \;

man 1 tar

find . -type f -name "*.tar.gz" -execdir sh -c '
   dirn="${1%.tar.gz}"         # desired directory name
   mkdir -- "$dirn"            # creating a directory
   cd -- "$dirn" &&
   tar -xvzf ../"$1"           # extracting to it
' find-sh {} \;

Explanations about Options.-C:
Change to DIR before performing any operations. This option is order-sensitive,
 i.e. it affects all options that follow.
Explanations about Options.-x:
Extract files from an archive. Arguments are optional. When given, they specify
 names of the archive members to be extracted.
